Welcome to Contact Book App’s documentation!¶

Contact Book App API main¶

main.healthchecker(db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The healthchecker function is a simple endpoint that returns a JSON object with the message ‘All right!’ if everything is working correctly. This function can be used to check if the API server and database are up and running.

Parameters:

db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A json object with the message “all right!”

Doc-author:

Trelent

async main.root()¶

The root function returns a JSON object with the message ‘Contact book’.

Returns:

A dict, which is converted into json

Doc-author:

Trelent

async main.startup()¶

The startup function is called when the application starts up. It’s a good place to initialize things that are needed by your app, such as connecting to databases or initializing caches.

Returns:

A list of coroutines

Doc-author:

Trelent

Contact Book App database Db¶

src.database.db.get_db()¶

The get_db function is a context manager that will automatically close the database connection when it goes out of scope. It also handles any exceptions that occur within the with block, rolling back any changes to the database and closing the session before re-raising them.

Returns:

A database connection

Doc-author:

Trelent

Contact Book App repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.birthday_7(current_user: int, db: Session)¶
The birthday_7 function returns a list of contacts whose birthday is within the next 7 days.
Args:

current_user (int): The id of the user who’s contacts are being searched. db (Session): A database session object to query for data.

Parameters:

  • current_user – int: Specify the user id of the current user

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contacts whose birthdays are in the next 7 days

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.create_contact(body, current_user: int, db: Session)¶
The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.
Args:

body (ContactCreate): The contact to create. current_user (int): The user id of the currently logged-in user.

Parameters:

  • body – Get the data from the request body

  • current_user – int: Get the user id of the current logged in user

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_by_id(contact_id: int, current_user: int, db: Session)¶
The get_contact_by_id function returns a contact by its id.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the contact to be returned. current_user (int): The user who is making the request for a specific contact. This is used to ensure that only contacts belonging to this user are returned, and not those belonging to other users in the database. db (Session): A connection with an open session with our database, which will allow us access and manipulation of data within it.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Identify the contact to be retrieved

  • current_user – int: Get the current user id from the token

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(current_user: int, limit: int, offset: int, db: Session)¶
The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts for the current user.
Args:

current_user (int): The id of the user whose contacts are being retrieved. limit (int): The number of results to return per page. Defaults to 10 if not specified by client request. offset (int): The number of results to skip before returning any data, used for pagination purposes. Defaults to 0 if not specified by client request.

Parameters:

  • current_user – int: Get the contacts of a specific user

  • limit – int: Limit the number of results returned

  • offset – int: Determine the number of contacts to skip

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_search(find_item: str, current_user: int, db: Session)¶

The get_search function takes in a string, the current user’s id, and the database session. It then searches for contacts that match the search string in their first name, last name or email. The results are returned as a list of Contact objects.

Parameters:

  • find_item – str: Search for a contact in the database

  • current_user – int: Get the user id of the current user

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contacts that match the search criteria

Doc-author:

Trelent

Contact Book App repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

The confirmed_email function takes in an email and a database session, and sets the confirmed field of the user with that email to True.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Get the email of the user that is trying to confirm their account

  • db – Session: Pass in the database session to the function

Returns:

None

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The create_user function creates a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Specify the type of data that will be passed to the function

  • db – Session: Get a database session

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → User | None¶

The get_user_by_email function takes in an email and a database session, and returns the user with that email if it exists. If no such user exists, it returns None.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the email of the user we want to get

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The first user with a matching email address

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(email, url: str, db: Session) → User¶

The update_avatar function updates the avatar of a user.

Parameters:

  • email – Find the user in the database

  • url – str: Specify the type of data that is being passed into the function

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, refresh_token, db: Session)¶
The update_token function updates the refresh token for a user in the database.
Args:

user (User): The User object to update. refresh_token (str): The new refresh token to store in the database. db (Session): A connection to our Postgres database.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Identify the user that is being updated

  • refresh_token – Update the refresh_token in the database

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The user with the updated refresh_token

Doc-author:

Trelent

Contact Book App routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The confirmed_email function is used to confirm a user’s email address.

It takes the token from the URL and uses it to get the user’s email address. The function then checks if there is a user with that email in our database, and if not, returns an error message. If there is a user with that email in our database, we check whether their account has already been confirmed or not. If it has been confirmed already, we return an appropriate message; otherwise we call repository_users’ confirmed_email function which sets the ‘confirmed’ field of that particular record to True.

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the token from the url

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A message that the email is already confirmed or a message that the email is confirmed

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The login function is used to authenticate a user. It takes the email and password of the user as input, and returns an access token and refresh token if successful.

Parameters:

  • body – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm: Validate the request body

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A token that is used to authenticate the user

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The refresh_token function is used to refresh the access token. It takes in a refresh token and returns a new access_token and refresh_token pair. The function first decodes the provided refresh token to get the email of its owner, then it gets that user from the database. If there is no such user or if their stored tokens don’t match, an error will be raised. Otherwise, a new pair of tokens will be created for this user and saved in the database.

Parameters:

  • credentials – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials: Get the token from the request

  • db – Session: Get a database session, and the credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials parameter is used to get the token from the request

Returns:

A dictionary with the new access_token, refresh_token and token type

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The request_email function is used to send an email to the user with a link that they can click on to confirm their email address. The function takes in a RequestEmail object, which contains the email of the user who wants to confirm their account. It then checks if there is already an account with that email address and if so, it sends them an email with a confirmation link.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Get the email from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the application

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A message to the user

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserModel, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The signup function creates a new user in the database.

It takes a UserModel object as input, which is validated by pydantic. The function then checks if an account with the same email already exists, and raises an error if it does. If no such account exists, it hashes the password using auth_service’s get_password_hash method and creates a new user in the database using repository_users’ create_user method.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Get the user data from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the application

  • db – Session: Get a database session

Returns:

A UserModel object

Doc-author:

Trelent

Contact Book App routes Contacts¶

async src.routes.contacts.birthday_7(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The birthday_7 function returns a list of contacts with birthdays in the next 7 days.

Parameters:

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository layer

Returns:

A list of contacts whose birthday is within a week

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

It takes an email, first_name, last_name and phone number like input parameters. The function returns the newly created contact object.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Get the request body of the post request

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository

Returns:

A ContactModel object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contact_by_id(contact_id: int = Path(Ellipsis), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_contact_by_id function is used to retrieve a contact by its id.
The function will return the contact if it exists, otherwise it will raise an HTTPException

with status code 404.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact to retrieve

  • current_user – User: Get the user id from the current_user object

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A contact object which is defined in the models

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = 0, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts for the current user.

Parameters:

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • le – Set a limit to the number of contacts that can be returned

  • offset – int: Specify the number of records to skip before returning the results

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository layer

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_search(find_item: str, current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_search function is used to search for a contact in the database.

The function takes in a string and returns all contacts that contain the string. If no contacts are found, an HTTP 404 error is returned.

Parameters:

  • find_item – str: Search for a contact by name

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository

Returns:

A list of contacts that match the search item

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.remove_contact_by_id(contact_id: int = Path(Ellipsis), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The remove_contact_by_id function removes a contact from the database.

The function takes in an integer representing the id of the contact to be removed, and returns a dictionary containing information about that contact.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact to be deleted

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact_by_id(body: ContactModel, contact_id: int = Path(Ellipsis), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The update_contact_by_id function updates a contact in the database.

The function takes an id of a contact and returns the updated contact. If no such user exists, it raises an HTTPException with status code 404 (Not Found).

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Get the contact model from the request body

  • contact_id – int: Get the contact id from the url

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

The updated contact

Doc-author:

Trelent

Contact Book App routes Users¶

async src.routes.users.read_users_me(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The read_users_me function is a GET request that returns the current user’s information.

It requires authentication, and it uses the auth_service to get the current user.

Parameters:

current_user – User: Tell fastapi that the function expects a user object

Returns:

The current_user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.users.update_avatar_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The update_avatar_user function updates the avatar of a user.
Args:

file (UploadFile): The image to be uploaded. current_user (User): The user whose avatar is being updated. This is passed in by the auth_service dependency, which uses JWT authentication to get the current user from their token’s payload and pass it into this function as an argument. If no valid token was provided, then this will return None instead of a User object, and thus raise an HTTPException with status code 401 Unauthorized because there was no valid authorization header present in the request that contained a JWT token with

Parameters:

  • file – UploadFile: Upload the file to cloudinary

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

The updated user

Doc-author:

Trelent

Contact Book App services Auth¶

async src.services.auth.create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_access_token function creates a JWT token that is used to authenticate the user.

The function takes in two arguments: data and expires_delta. Data is a dictionary containing information about the user, such as their username and email address. Expires_delta is an optional argument that specifies how long the access token will be valid for (in seconds). If no value for expires_delta is provided, then it defaults to 15 minutes.

Parameters:

  • data – dict: Pass the data that will be encoded in the jwt

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the access token

Returns:

A string that is the encoded access token

Doc-author:

Trelent

src.services.auth.create_email_token(data: dict)¶

The create_email_token function takes a dictionary of data and returns a token. The token is encoded with the secret key, algorithm, and expiration date.

Parameters:

data – dict: Pass in the data that will be encoded into the token

Returns:

A token that is used to verify the user’s email address

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.services.auth.create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_refresh_token function creates a refresh token for the user.
Args:

data (dict): A dictionary containing the user’s id and username. expires_delta (Optional[float]): The number of seconds until the refresh token expires. Defaults to None, which is 7 days in seconds.

Parameters:

  • data – dict: Pass the user’s id and username to the function

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time for the token

Returns:

An encoded refresh token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.services.auth.decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶

The decode_refresh_token function is used to decode the refresh token. It will raise an HTTPException if the token is invalid or has expired.

Parameters:

refresh_token – str: Pass in the refresh token that is sent to the server

Returns:

A payload

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.services.auth.get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be used in the

protected endpoints. It uses the OAuth2 authorization scheme to get and validate JWT tokens. If validation is successful, it returns an object of type User.

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the token from the authorization header

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The user object that corresponds to the token payload

Doc-author:

Trelent

src.services.auth.get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

The get_email_from_token function takes a token as an argument and returns the email address associated with that token. If the token is invalid, it raises an HTTPException.

Parameters:

token – str: Pass the token to the function

Returns:

The email from the token

Doc-author:

Trelent

src.services.auth.get_password_hash(password: str)¶

The get_password_hash function takes a password as an argument and returns the hashed version of that password. The hash is generated using the pwd_context object’s hash method, which uses bcrypt to generate a secure hash.

Parameters:

password – str: Specify the password that is being hashed

Returns:

A hash of the password

Doc-author:

Trelent

src.services.auth.verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶

The verify_password function takes a plain-text password and a hashed password and verifies that the two match. It returns True if they do, False otherwise.

Parameters:

  • plain_password – Store the password that is inputted by the user

  • hashed_password – Store the hashed password

Returns:

True if the password is correct, and false otherwise

Doc-author:

Trelent

Contact Book App services Cloud_image¶

src.services.cloud_image.generate_image_name(email: str)¶

The generate_image_name function takes an email address as input and returns a unique image name. The function uses the hashlib library to generate a SHA256 hash of the email address, then truncates it to 16 characters. This ensures that each user has a unique image name.

Parameters:

email – str: Specify the type of data that will be passed into the function

Returns:

A string of 16 characters

Doc-author:

Trelent

src.services.cloud_image.get_avatar_url(public_id: str, r)¶

The get_avatar_url function takes in a public_id and an r (which is the result of a cloudinary.api.resource call) and returns the URL for that image, with width=250, height=250, crop=’fill’, and version set to whatever was returned by the resource call.

Parameters:

  • public_id – str: Specify the public id of the image to be fetched

  • r – Get the version of the image

Returns:

A url to the avatar image

Doc-author:

Trelent

src.services.cloud_image.upload_image(file, public_id: str)¶

The upload_image function takes a file and public_id as arguments. The function then uploads the file to Cloudinary using the public_id provided.

Parameters:

  • file – Specify the file to upload

  • public_id – str: Set the public id of the image

Returns:

A dictionary containing the public_id and url of the uploaded image

Doc-author:

Trelent

Contact Book App services email¶

async src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶
The send_email function sends an email to the user with a link to confirm their email address.
The function takes in three parameters:

-email: EmailStr, the user’s email address that they entered when signing up for an account. -username: str, the username of the user who is trying to sign up for an account. This will be used in conjunction with host (see below) and token_verification (see below) as part of a URL that will be sent via email to verify their identity and allow them access into our application.

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: Specify the email address of the user

  • username – str: Personalize the email

  • host – str: Pass the host of the application to the template

Returns:

A coroutine object

Doc-author:

Trelent
